favourite.article: The dear sister who wrote this hymn is right now in the hospital, maybe ready to meet anew her God of glory! May her spirit and the flavor of glory that so inspired this song permeate the hearts that sing this, being made ready for the God of glory to appear to them!

God of glory, God of glory, Do appear to us today, Saturate and permeate us Till You fully have Your way. From that evil foreign land. Get out, get out, from Chaldea, Come in, come in, to the good land, Christ, the church, the one new man. Lord, we’re crossing every river— For this You must call us on, Till Your kingdom and expression On this earth are fully come. God of glory, God of glory, Do appear to us each day, Call us out into Your building, Your desire on earth today. This is such an enjoyable hymn. This should be our daily prayer
Praise our Lord the God of glory!!!
Amen, we're crossing every river. Lord You must call us on, till Your kingdom and expression on this earth fully comes...
Once we were in old Chaldea, Worshiping the idols there; But the God of glory called us, Saved us all from Satan's snare.
Amen. He has called us from Chaldea to the promised land.

This hymn was giving me strength today, since I'm experiencing prosecution from my own "Christian" parents for being in the recovery. Thank God He is everything to me, and we're enjoying Him daily (me, my wife and little baby Victoria). Praise The Lord I need to be more attached to Him now :)
I really love this song. This song really reminds me of the Lord. I would hear this song every morning, and will not get bored of it. :)
Yeah it was...and this is a really good song, I enjoyed verse 2.
I was at that conference too. It was amazing.

I was enjoying this song one morning and it touched me very much. Not long after I was at the Memorial Day Conference in Philly, and the Lord reminded me of this song during Message Four, "The Recovery of Living the Life of the Altar and the Tent." It's such a fitting song for this message. I am still singing it as my prayer and constitution from the message so that the Lord can make this my reality in my living for the church.
